intro: Hieracium epiphaeum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disc, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium epiphaeum is often found in open, sunny areas at high elevations.
